page.title: 12Walsden Cricket Club (cont).
page.content: The one and only time Walsden have won the league was in 1964, although they shared it with Stockport in 1962. The present professional is Moshin Khan, the Pakistan Test player. He holds the club batting record with 1,368 runs in a season. Other professionals over the years include, Everton Weekes, Bob Bartels and Cec Wright. Trevor Chappel, professional in 1975 and who later played in the Australian test side, holds the League record for the most runs (1,205) and wickets (112) taken in a season. Famous visiting professionals are numerous and include Sir Gary Sobers. Walsden Cricket and Bowling Club is a very successful and well run club and is one of the best supported teams in the CLL and it is hoped that the Club will continue it's success in the years to come.
